CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . In CARDINAL he obtained CARDINAL judgments against the authorities .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the applicant MONEY ( “ RUB ” ) in pension arrears against ORG . This judgment became binding on DATE , but was not enforced immediately . In CARDINAL , the bailiff ’s service ’s servicing bank had its licence suspended pending insolvency proceedings . On DATE the bailiffs made a bank transfer to the applicant , but the transfer failed because of a clerical mistake .

CARDINAL . As the applicant believed that the bailiffs had caused the delay , on DATE he sued them for the judgment debt and non - pecuniary damages . After CARDINAL ﬁrst - instance hearings , CARDINAL appeal hearing , and CARDINAL supervisory - review hearings , on DATE ORG partly held for the applicant . It conﬁrmed the bailiffs’ fault , awarded RUB CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL that included the original judgment debt adjusted for ination and costs , but rejected the claim for non - pecuniary damages .

CARDINAL . Both the applicant and the bailiffs appealed against this judgment , but the applicant ’s appeal was not accepted because he had missed the time - limit . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE . The applicant and the bailiffs were absent from this hearing . Earlier the applicant had asked the courts to examine the case in his absence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiffs enforced the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG enforced the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment within DATE . Under section QUANTITY of LAW of DATE , ORG must enforce a judgment within DATE .
